item.title: [hypersion] player.face() method help [SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

I’d wager that it’s unrelated to the code you posted, I can’t see anything there that would case that. I’d guess it’s something to do with how you’re updating the player’s data. By that I mean, rather than sending an update for an individual player to face the said direction, you’re sending it too all players involved in the woodcutting process.

Read full topic

item.title: [hypersion] player.face() method help [SOLVED]
item.dc:creator: @chazion chazion
item.description:
@chazion wrote:

EDIT: just realized my title says hypersion. keeping.

preez exprain me y.

Ive made an event to handle woodcutting and im confused as to why the placer.face() method causes all players who are woodcutting to face that direction.

i will post whatever is needed

player.face(Location.create(x, y)); // blablaevent.java

public void face(Location location) { //mob.java
		this.face = location;
		this.updateFlags.flag(UpdateFlag.FACE_COORDINATE);
	}

public static Location create(int x, int y, int z) { //location.java
		return new Location(x, y, z);
	}

y jesus

Read full topic
